intro: Trichosalpinx minutipetala, commonly known as the small-petaled trichosalpinx, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are small, typically pink or purple, and are arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland environments.
